rule: Generate a rule to fuzz the TensorFlow Lite API by providing a parameter filter_input_channel of less than 1 when constructing a TFLite model. This can result in a Floating Point Exception (FPE).

Generate malformed input by setting the filter_input_channel parameter to less than or equal to 0 for the TensorFlow Lite Prepare API used in conv kernels. This can trigger a FPE as mentioned in the bug description.

Generate a malformed input for the tf.nn.fractional_avg_pool_v2 and tf.nn.fractional_max_pool_v2 APIs by setting the first and fourth elements of the pooling_ratio parameter to a value other than 1.0. This will cause a double-free bug as pooling on batch and channel dimensions is not currently supported.
Rule for Malformed Input Generation: For the TensorFlow API ```tf.raw_ops.ParallelConcat```, provide a parameter called ```shape``` with a value of 0 or less than 0.
Generate malformed input for tf.raw_ops.Bincount by providing a parameter 'weights' that has a different shape than the parameter 'arr' or a length-0 tensor.

Generate a malformed input by providing a seed value below -4294967296 for the TensorFlow API ```RandomShuffle``` with parameter values {'value': 1e+20, 'seed': <seed value>, 'seed2': -2147483649} when XLA is enabled. This can trigger a Null Pointer Exception (NPE) as explained in the Bug description.
